Posts.Content: May 21, 2011 06:39PM Wabi-sabi wrote: Hi MP2, welcome to the site! I am new at this also, but will offer my two cents if it helps at all. Here's some of my story:  I received a Birads of 5 and that has a 95% chance of being malignent. Thank the Good Lord the doctor didn't tell me my Birads # until After she said my tumor was benign. Because I would have been going nutts!- and it would have all been understandable but in the end, a lot of wasted energy. It's hard. You can't help but worry but try to focus on the now, things you can control, rather than things that are out of your hands at this point. You have seen the doctor in a timely manner, been a responsible young lady, now keep yourself busy with doing fun things that maybe you wouldn't even normally do- I ate a whole meal of pizza, rootbeer and m&m's and didn't allow myself a tinge of guilt and it felt great!!! When I focused too much on the "what if" I felt terrible, jittery and cranky!! I know it's hard I was scared too!! still kinda am of the surgery, but I've done what I can do, I'm not going to spoil the here & now, life's too short! I don't know if this helps but you are SO not alone. I did feel better after the ultrasound/ mammo eventhough it wasn't the best outcome, because I felt like I was Doing something. Best wishes to you, please chime in again if you need more support!! also there's Xanex and Benadryl to help sleep if you need it :)
Posts.Title: New - age 30 - palpable lump waiting for ultrasound MP2 JanetinVirginia

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2011 06:12PM - edited Jun 6, 2011 06:13PM by Wabi-sabi So glad to hear it!!!! yay!!! I love happy endings!!  Best wishes to your family :)
Posts.Title: Update on me - good news! upnorthgal AMP614

Posts.Content: May 17, 2011 10:17AM Wabi-sabi wrote: Getting my biopsy today... didn't think I was that nervous until I woke up at 4 am with all these dreams about diagnoses and telling people and all this crazy stuff.. I feel so jumpy yet I still have to go to work...which I'm actually glad about because it gives me something to do!! That is, I have things to do in my life too but work takes the focus off of me and I love that! I kinda just wish this whole stinking thing would go away..can anyone relate? haha I heard someone say "Don't think past 24 hours" I love that too! I am getting so many wonderful little nuggets of wisdom here thank you!!!! Prayers to you All!!
Posts.Title: talking to family & friends Wabi-sabi Wabi-sabi

Posts.Content: May 21, 2011 02:17PM Wabi-sabi wrote: Thank you carpediem!! I guess May 20 was my lucky day. I'm glad I didn't ask the Radiologist what the score was while waiting for my biopsy results. (Would she have even had it yet? Not sure how all that works, obviously! lol)   That would have just made my gutt wrench even more. I usually say knowledge is power,  but in this case I'd say ignorance was bliss :)  If I have to go throught this whole mess again one day, I'm taking a much more positive attitude and what the heck I will even take the tranquilizers if I need to.
Posts.Title: talking to family & friends Wabi-sabi Wabi-sabi

Posts.Content: May 14, 2011 10:38AM Wabi-sabi wrote: Thank you for talking to me!! It is so beyond nice just to be heard and actually understood by someone who has been there!! Yes Leaf you are so right on! Saying the wrong thing does hurt. I have friends that had a child born with severe abnormalities. Hannah had a life expectancy of a few months, tops. She showed those docs by living to almost 4 years, and she was the apple of her parent's eye. However after she passed some people said things to the effect of, "well at least that's over." Just what every grieving parent wants to hear. (Luckily the parents are both very grounded, intelligent people so there were no fist fights at the funeral.) But I thought, boy they just didn't get how awesome that precious little girl was!! And  what an absolutely horrid thing to say.  Yeah that may be part of why I don't want to tell people either, no matter the diagnosis. Of coarse I would tell my family, but I don't want to get get well cards either, I don't want to be talked about, I don't want to be stared at, and if I do decide to share it with someone I want to know that they won't be weird about it and I just can't predict that.I don't want people feeling sorry for me!! People do get better! But I also don't want the dismissive, "oh I had that 10 years ago you'll be fine" Don't tell me they weren't scared at the beginning too! Why do some people have to pretend they're so tough. As far as telling my boys, that was necessary because my older one had done a history of searches on the computer. He came up to me with a nervous look on his face and said, "so do you have cancer?" I hadn't even told him I had a mammogram yet. I was caught off guard and said, no I don't have cancer, but my husband felt they should know what's up so we had a little talk. I would tell the girls if they lived closer. I want to be able to just tell them hey, make sure you get checked because I have a lump and although it turned out benign, I am so glad I have the peace of mind now that I'm healthy. But how am I going to tell them if it's malignant? I mean what do people actually say? I don't want to cry and scare them but I don't want to be too casual... guess I will cross that bridge when and IF I come to it.  Julie I Love how the people at work support you! I know that isn't everyone's experience. I have only been at my new job for 5 months so I haven't really had a chance to develop solid relationships. Incredibly enough, I switched jobs because the school district I worked for didn't offer health insurance, and with the real estate market being so bad, my husband isn't able to pay for it out of pocket. (I think that was a very good move on my part! Phew!) I work with special needs adults which I totally love. I have wanted to go back to school for nursing for a long time but financially it's not happening. Anyway!- so should I expect the Radiologist to call me after the biopsy? Do they just give you a yes/no type thing or do they tell you the stages and all of that? I am sorry Carpediem that you don't feel you have close friends to share this with. I had a close friend that got a little too close to my husband (yes this has been One Heck of a year) so now I have friends that are good but I don't know, I think I keep people an arm's length away as they say. My husband and I are good btw, actually probably better than ever, after lots of work, and he has been very supportive through the whole little scare. I really hope this is benign. I could use a break!!! But then again I feel like I do have a break in life because I have this discussion board and you guys who read my stuff and give me advice and I do have huge faith in God and I know that I will get through the whole thing... listen to me, I get so dramatic! haha. I imagine I will feel pretty silly when I get the good news. But I know you guys won't laugh at me because you have been there. Thank you thank you thank you, Cybersisters!! Hugs back at you guys too!! :)
Posts.Title: talking to family & friends Wabi-sabi Wabi-sabi

Posts.Content: May 21, 2011 01:41AM Wabi-sabi wrote: Thank you guys!! Yes it was a relief. To tell you the truth I had myself a little convinced that it would swing the other way. The doc said the surgery team would be calling me by Monday to schedule a time. Can anyone tell me what I might expect from an excision?- as far as hospital stay, recovery, etc?  and carpediem what do you mean the 5% club??
Posts.Title: talking to family & friends Wabi-sabi Wabi-sabi

Posts.Content: May 24, 2011 07:37PM Wabi-sabi wrote: One of my favorite things in the Entire World is an honestly answered question. I love it. Thank you mdoak for saying what I was thinking!! Even-though it *wasn't* what I wanted to hear- but I'm still happy anyway because I feel less paranoid and crazy. And that's always a good feeling ;) My consultation is Thursday morning with the surgeon. Any suggestions as to what exactly I shouldn't forget to ask?
Posts.Title: Birads 5 Wabi-sabi leaf

Posts.Content: May 23, 2011 11:01PM Wabi-sabi wrote: Wow such quick responses, I thank you!!  I probably should have made myself a little more clear. They have done a biopsy, (core needle) and have told me the results were benign. yay! However the doctor went on to sound pretty much just as worried as ever, saying something about the reports not matching?- (I lost concentration after the word "benign"!) She talked about how I was a Birad 4 and that my tumor didn't look good, something about irregular shape, size, and growth rate- plus my age, I'm 45- that was fun-  then she called me right back and said Oh I meant to say you are a Birad 5. So I went around all happy until my mind started to ask, if it was that abnormal, are they sure it's benign? Why the hurry to scoop it out if it's benign-? I don't know much about BC, I think I know just enough as they say to get myself into trouble. Thank you again everyone for the concern, believe me all the good thoughts & vibes are totally returned!!!
Posts.Title: Birads 5 Wabi-sabi leaf

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2011 12:40AM Wabi-sabi wrote: yay!! Happy for you! :)
Posts.Title: B9 for me apaige lisa645

Posts.Content: Wabi-sabi wrote: Hello everyone :) I would love to find out what other women have shared with their families and when. Basically I found a lump, doc sent me for a Mammogram/ Ultrasound, the lump turned out to be a mass, 2 cm, (they didn't even have to tell me, I could tell it was a mass by the abrupt hault of conversation and the concentrated looks on their faces...you'd think they would have developed  pretty good poker faces by now, but no!) and now I go on Tuesday for a biopsy. Yes I am worried but I know the chances of this little guy being cancer are only about 20%.  I told my mom about the whole thing, wouldn't have ordinarily but I happened to be visiting her out of town for Mother's Day and that's the day I found it. My husband went with me to the appointments so he knows. My boys, 17 and 23, apparently could tell something was up so I told them the facts too. My girls however, who are 19 and 21, no longer live at home and I'm not sure I need to let them know anything. I will tell them Thursday if it's good news or bad, that's the day I should get my results. So anyway!- haha like I mentioned, I would like to know how other women told their families. I haven't actually been diagnosed with anything but a mass yet, and I don't want to worry people needlessly...would be nice to talk to my friends but I really do not want to tell them either. One of my daughters is out of the country for the next 4 months, don't want to tell her over skype or worse yet Facebook, (her cell doesn't work in England), but what are my choices? Aah! Advice please :) Thank you in advance!! And thank goodness for this web site, I wouldn't have a clue who to ask!! Wabi-sabi Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: talking to family & friends Wabi-sabi Wabi-sabi

Posts.Content: May 15, 2011 11:16AM Wabi-sabi wrote: This makes me feel so much better, just to talk to others. I have limited myself to checking the boards only a couple of times a day (okay 3) because I don't want to obsess about this. It's so true if I don't occupy myself I get so jumpy!! yes I have rearranged 2 of the rooms in my house so far and today I will probably do 2 more! Thanks for all the advice, I treasure each word and feel loved. I will definitely "chill until" I love that. I'm so new at this I had to google "excision". Haha guess I have a lot to learn!   I care about you all too so please keep me updated!!! Yes the waiting like Tom Petty said is the hardest part!!!! :) hugs :)
Posts.Title: talking to family & friends Wabi-sabi Wabi-sabi

Posts.Content: May 20, 2011 07:44PM Wabi-sabi wrote:  I got my results today, benign! What a lovely word. I'm Birads 5 though so the doctor wants to take the nasty little thing out and I said have at it!! Glad to see it go!!! I still love you all and pray for you. Good luck everyone!

Posts.Content: May 24, 2011 07:40PM Wabi-sabi wrote: btw if anybody is wondering what the heck Wabi-sabi means, it's a word that means beautiful as it is but not yet finished. There's a whole philosophy that goes along with it that's really pretty, you can google it if you're curious.  But my name is really Cindy. And I thank everybody who ever reads or responds to me because I need the support.
Posts.Title: Birads 5 Wabi-sabi leaf

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2011 03:44AM Wabi-sabi wrote: I'm so sorry that I haven't checked the boards lately, and you wonderful people have written me. I really hope that nobody Ever thinks I am ignoring their remarks, I treasure Each and Every one of them. Truly. I have another thread going, about my lumpectomy, and I gave the results on that one. I don't know how these messages work, exactly, so in case people didn't read that one I will fill you in now...surgery went fine, tumor was B9. Doc wants to do another mammo in 3 months and I was wondering if that was standard procedure. He said the films didn't look good and he wanted to be sure he removed the full thing, and to be sure nothing was hiding. I just said basically okay yeah sure I will do the mammo, but I'm just wondering why don't they give me a, get outta here! haha like on Seinfeld. It sounds silly, I know, but why more tests if they already biopsied the lump, removed the lump, and now they want to double check that it's gone? Well at least I feel well taken care of. I hope so much that you all have good results or excellent progress or both. Love to you- Cindy (Wabi-Sabi) also please update me on how you all are doing! Sorry I'm not very computer savy!
Posts.Title: Birads 5 Wabi-sabi leaf

Posts.Content: May 17, 2011 09:30PM Wabi-sabi wrote: How was your biopsy? Mine is all over now. I am so much less nervous after they are done with the procedures than before. I hope your experience is also a good one and that you had nice people with a sense of humor and kindness that performed your biopsy like I did. Now the next phase of waiting begins: the results. Remember you are not alone at this game!!

The doctor wants to remove it, consultation on Thursday with the surgeon, ( which I'm glad of)  but should I still be concerned or no? What I mean is, can I basically kinda cross the whole cancer scare off my list or is there a real chance they'll look at the tumor and say, whoops it's malignent after all-? I'm a little confused!  Thank you!!   Wabi-sabi Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Birads 5 Wabi-sabi leaf

Posts.Content: May 26, 2011 11:41PM Wabi-sabi wrote: Well yes you were right! They want to take a look at the little guy to make sure it's ok. The surgeon did say that he thought the biopsy was very well done, and he will be surprised if anything to the contrary should show up on the next pathology report. I will be put completely out (yay! another blessing!) the recovery time is only a few days, and I should get the final word within a day or two. Only thing is he printed out a pathology report and he did explain it to me, and then he handed it to me, but it disappeared on my way to the car! Ugggh! He gave me the x-rays though which are pretty cool. I think I like this doctor.  Surgery June 16 :) In the meantime I am going to take this whole episode and try to forget it, except  I will  never ever forget you all and the awesome help I have received here!!! Blessings to every one of you beautiful ladies!!! Take care of yourself and your families!!!! m-wah! bye for now!!!
